src.measure.pixel_intensity module

src.measure.pixel_intensity.ccfbf(ts, ts2)[source]

centered cross correlation of two time series

Parameters

  • ts (numpy.ndarray, (T,)) – first time series

  • ts2 (numpy.ndarray, (T,)) – second time series

Returns

crosscorr – centered cross correlation

Return type

(2T-1,)

src.measure.pixel_intensity.intensity_ts(msk, measure, dz, outline)[source]

read multipoint ROIs; converts to binary mask where ROI is True

Parameters

  • msk (numpy.ndarray, (T,X,Y), bool) – pixels to measure

  • measure (numpy.ndarray, (T,X,Y)) – intensity image stack

  • dz (numpy.ndarray, (DT,), int) – time offset to measure intensity

  • outline (numpy.ndarray, (X,Y), bool) – mask of pixels in embryo

Returns

ts – intensity at different time offsets

Return type

numpy.ndarray, (DT,#pixels in msk)

src.measure.pixel_intensity.roi_to_stkmask(imshape, zgroups, path_circles)[source]

read multipoint ROIs; converts to binary mask where ROI is True

Parameters

  • imshape (tuple) – (T,X,Y)

  • zgroups (nested 1D array) – frames that are grouped together

  • path_circles (str) – path to ROIs

Returns

msk – binary mask where ROI is True

Return type

numpy.ndarray, (T,X,Y), bool
